qas.question: How many casualties did the Soviet Union have during WWII?
The Soviet Union was first invaded by Nazi controlled Germany in what year?
Until what year, was the US the sole possessor of the atomic bomb?
In what year did Stalin order the development of ICBMs?
What type of military force did the US possess a much larger fleet than the Soviet Union?

context: For its part, the Soviet Union harbored fears of invasion. Having suffered at least <a0_0>27 million<a0_0/> casualties during World War II after being invaded by Nazi Germany in <a1_0>1941<a1_0/>, the Soviet Union was wary of its former ally, the United States, which until late <a2_0>1949<a2_0/> was the sole possessor of atomic weapons. The United States had used these weapons operationally during World War II, and it could use them again against the Soviet Union, laying waste its cities and military centers. Since the Americans had a much larger <a4_0>air force<a4_0/> than the Soviet Union, and the United States maintained advance air bases near Soviet territory, in <a3_0>1947<a3_0/> Stalin ordered the development of intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) in order to counter the perceived American threat.
